title: Revolutionary Nonviolence [w txt] Declaration Unviolent War - Da
description:
Revolutionary Nonviolence [w txt] Declaration Unviolent War - Dave Dellinger

Amy Goodman, Howard Zinn, Father Dan Berrigan, Tom Hayden memorialize Dave Dellinger - http://www.democracynow.org/2004/5/27/revolutionary_non_violence_remembering_dave_dellinger

DAVE'S MOST FAMOUS ESSAY - CH 2 DECLARATION OF WAR.

URGENT, PLS, SEED, SEED, SEED ALL, ALL, ALL ... UnviolentPeaceMaker\'s TPB uploads. 
SOON I MAY BE PREVENTED.  DO IT.  
KEEP THESE TORRENTS ALIVE.  Thanks.  All of them.  
Every precious one.  
Depends on YOU.  
Thnx.

---------------

'Dave Dellingers close contact with other activists--from Martin Luther King, Jr., and Bayard Rustin to Abbie Hoffman and Tom Hayden--permits Dellinger to offer a frank review 

of their actions and motives, but his memoir is most remarkable for its depiction of the trials and tribulations of one man's life of conscience.  
 <a href="
http://www.kirkusreviews.com/book-reviews/david-dellinger/from-yale-to-jail/" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.kirkusreviews.com/book-reviews/david-dellinger/from-yale-to-jail/</a>


Wikipedia - http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Dellinger .



NOTE 1. Read by a very good ATT voice.  Dont like it?  Dont download it.  Dont complain.  Dont get in the way.


NOTE 2. TEXT SCAN UNKNOWN QUALITY - Scanned years ago I dont recall how clean the text is, tho a spot check seems it is very good.

Kathy Kelly [ http://vcnv.org/speaker-bio/kathy-kelly ], often proposed for the Nobel Peace Prize, the person that does stuff like setting up human shields in Iraq to discourage the Bush bombing recommended Dave Dellinger as one of the two finest theorists and practitioners of Unviolent Theory, Wisdom, Knowledge....  I cant disagree.
